court: HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT BERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR
outcome: IN CC NO.1019/2019 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS -II, HOSDRUG CRIME NO.303/2019 OF NILESWARAM POLICE STATION, KASARGOD PETITIONER/ACCUSED: SHIHAB T.V., AGED 31 YEARS, S/O.ABDUL KHADER, RESIDIN
full_text: Crate ca ie a rc ia 2020/KER/261 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT BERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE P.B.SURESH KUMAR MONDAY, THE O6TH DAY OF JANUARY 2020 / 16TH POUSHA, 1941 Cr1.MC.No.9269 OF 2019 (G) AGAINST THE ORDER IN CC NO.1019/2019 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS -II, HOSDRUG CRIME NO.303/2019 OF NILESWARAM POLICE STATION, KASARGOD PETITIONER/ACCUSED: SHIHAB T.V., AGED 31 YEARS, S/O.ABDUL KHADER, RESIDING AT ORCHA, ORCHA ROAD, KOTTAPPURAM, NEELESHWAR VILLAGE, KOTTAPPURAM.P.O., HOSDURG TALUK, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. BY ADVS. SRI .T.MADHU SMT .C.R.SARADAMANT RESPONDENT/STATE & DE FACTO COMPLAINANT: 1 THE STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682031. 2 THE STATION HOUSE OFFICER, NEELESWARAM POLICE STATION, KASARAGOD DISTRICT-671314. 3 SHANIDHA M., D/O.SHAFI.P., AGED 25 YEARS, RESIDING AT SHANIDHA QUARTERS, COLONY ROAD, THAIKKADAPPURAM, P.O. THATKKADAPPURAM, KASARAGOD DISTRICT-671315. R3 BY ADV. SRI.M.ABDUL KAREEM SRI. AMJED ALI PP THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 06.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Carrara a rap 2020/KER/261 Crl.M.C. No.9269 of 2019 2 Cril.M.C.No.9269 of 2019 ORDER This is a proceedings instituted under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for quashing Annexure A2 final report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto now pending as C.C.No.1019 of 2019 on the files of the Court of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class - Il, Hosdurg against the petitioner. 2. The petitioner is the sole accused in the said case and the case is one instituted at the instance of the third respondent, the wife of the petitioner, under Section 498A of the Indian Penal Code. 3. It is seen that the petitioner and the de facto complainant have settled their disputes, and an affidavit to that effect has been filed by the third respondent as Annexure A3. 4. The learned counsel for the third respondent affirms that Annexure A3 is an affidavit sworn to by the defacto complainant, and submits that the third respondent has no Carrara ape 2020/KER/261 Crl.M.C. No.9269 of 2019 3 objection in granting the relief sought for by the petitioner. 5. In the light of the decisions of the Apex Court in Gian singh v. State of Punjab, (2012) 10 SCC 303, Narinder singh v. State of Punjab, (2014) 6 SCC 466 and Jitendra Raghuvanshi & Others v. Babita Raghuvanshi & Another, (2013) 4 SCC 58, | am of the view that this is an appropriate case where this court has to invoke the jurisdiction under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure to quash the proceedings against the petitioner. In the result, the Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-A2 final report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto against the petitioner pending as C.C.No.1019 of 2019 on the files of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class - Il, Hosdurg are quashed. Sd/- P.B.SURESH KUMAR, JUDGE. YKB Le: a a rc ia 2020/KER/261 Crl.M.C. No.9269 of 2019 4 APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE Al THE TRUE CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FIR DATED 22.8.2019 IN CRIME NO.303/2019 OF NEELESWARAM POLICE STATION, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. ANNEXURE A2 THE TRUE CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT DATED 31.10.2019 IN CRIME NO.303/2019 OF NELESWARAM POLICE STATION, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. ANNEXURE A3 THE AFFIDAVIT DATED 29.11.2019 SWORN IN BY THE 3RD RESPONDENT. RESPONDENT'S/S EXHIBITS: NIL //TRUE COPY// PA TO JUDGE
